_decoded_content.title: Youtube re-organization
_decoded_content.description:
When I land on Youtube or the google videos view I see a bunch of content with deprecated features in them. For example when I search on youtube for meltano I see "A Tour with Meltano v1.0" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tf_EIbwDmXk as a top video.

For 2.0 it would be awesome to hide all the legacy content from before we were a dataops OS or put it in under a legacy playlist or tag. I'm sort of in favor of hiding it because people might still land on those videos through google searches and get confused.

I thought I created an issue for this already but wasnt able find it. Happy to close this if its already logged somewhere else.

cc @Emily @afolson

_decoded_content.title: Demo Day: June 9, 2022
_decoded_content.description:
## Todos

- [ ] Monday: Add this ticket to Kickoff doc
- [ ] Monday: Source demos from the community and confirm Meltano's demos with Engineering/Product
- [ ] Monday: Draft Tweets for the week
   - [ ] For Monday or Tuesday: Announce time, mention a specific demo, and encourage folks to join us on Slack.
   - [ ] For Thursday an hour before DD: Announce that demo day is in one hour, encourage people to come see us, inform that we'll post the YouTube link soon
   - [ ] For Thursday when we go live: Create a draft announcing that we're live with a placeholder for the YouTube Link.
- [ ] Monday: Draft Slack Announcements and schedule
  - [ ] Monday or Tuesday: Post to #demo-day and "Share" post to #announcements
  - [ ] Thursday an hour before DD: Post to #demo-day that we start in an hour.
  - [ ] Thursday when we go live: `@channel` mention that we're live and post a link to the Zoom URL
- [ ] Before: Create/clean up [Demo Day deck](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Pp56ORBQeFd6JvLuzIERr0GaSps5n2fJmjxvd5mmP3E/edit?usp=sharing)
- [ ] Thursday - 1hr before: Double check that announcements were posted to #demo-day and #announcements
- [ ] Thursday: Set up stream per instructions here: https://meltano.com/handbook/marketing/community.html#streaming-from-zoom-to-youtube
- [ ] Thursday: Tweet out when YouTube stream is live (if you can't, make sure someone is on deck to tweet)
- [ ] Thursday: Post Zoom link to #demo-day/#announcements Slack channels when stream is live (if you can't, make sure someone is on deck to post)
- [ ] Thursday: Edit live stream video per instructions here: https://meltano.com/handbook/marketing/community.html#after-the-livestream-session-ends
- [ ] Thursday: Thank community folks who joined the call with us in #demo-day
- [ ] Thursday: Write recap blog post with highlights from Demo Day
- [ ] Thursday: Open next week's issue.
- [ ] Thursday: Tag YouTube video with appropriate tags
- [ ] Friday: Tweet a link to the blog post during peak hours

_decoded_content.title: Getting Started Cleanup
_decoded_content.description:
### Brief 
(Summarize activity)
* Due Date: May 26
* Type: documentation 

### For Draft.dev
- Description: Need to create a streamlined version of our getting started guide
- Audience: technical users 
- Writer resources: https://docs.meltano.com/getting-started


### Todos

Misc Musings:
- [ ] Search should be obvious on home page
- [ ] Update speedrun, remove links and references to "code on website" since those steps are no longer there.
- [ ] CSS: Spacing after code blocks and numbered lists is wonky.
- [ ] Add TOC/3 column layout with a sticky TOC

Getting Started Guide:
- [ ] Goal: trim down the guide and make it more user friendly
- [ ] Remove links to home page samples
- [ ] Consider moving away from tap-gitlab as this requires creating an account. Is tap-github a better choice here? Most power users (our current target audience) will likely have an account. Consider taps that don't require auth as well.
- [ ] List installation methods and link to those sections in the Installation Guide. Having this info in two places means remembering to update it in 2 places :grimacing: We should choose the least complicated path to installation for this example but tell them that other options are available if they need them. Figure out if Docker installation or local installation is easier?
- [ ] Use a consistent example project name
- [ ] We mention "discoverable" plugins early on but don't really define what that means. Make sure this ends up in the glossary that we still need to make :grimacing:

_decoded_content.title: 2.0 Blog (live June 9th)
_decoded_content.description:
### Brief 
(Summarize activity)
* Due Date: May 26th
* Type: Blog
* Draft: 

### outline
- What 2.0 means (end to end)
  - Version 2.0 is the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) release of Meltano as a full DataOps OS
  - Beyond ELT, ELT as a Wedge
  - Mention funding to support end to end vision
- New in Meltano 2.0 
  - Features Snowflake as the primary data warehouse vendor and the following open source components (talk about happy path): 
     - Singer taps and targets for data replication
     - dbt for data transformations
     - Airflow for orchestration
     - Great Expectations for data quality
     - Superset for analysis
- Highlights of Meltano 2.0 include:
  - Improved flexibility in how jobs are defined and scheduled to take full advantage of our composable pipelines
  - Inline transformations for Singer-based plugins to enable on-the-fly data transformations
  - Greater stability in Meltano projects with the addition of the Meltano lockfile.
  - Easier configuration experience for new users via an interactive CLI for updating settings.
  - Enhancements to Meltano Environments, including sensible defaults and clarified environment variable inheritance patterns
  - Routine maintenance, bug squashing, deprecation of legacy features and elimination of technical debt.
  - Include demo video is we have it
- Hub updates
  - Release also elevates MeltanoHub to be the complete resource for plugins available for use with Meltano. This includes the large library of Singer plugins, along with alternative analysis tools like Lightdash and Evidence and data utilities like SQLFluff. Users are also able to add more plugins to the Hub and have them immediately discoverable and usable within Meltano.
- Looking forward 
  - Roadmap (include big milestones)
  - Managed Meltano

- CTA- try 2.0


### Todos

- [ ] xyz

_decoded_content.title: Prep Materials for Funding and 2.0 PR
_decoded_content.description:
#Announcement 
For when we announce the funding. The more info we have sooner to pitch media the better. We need allt he data we have to show traction. talk growth, features- want tight chronicle of progress that has been made. Need to have a message that is of interest beyond data verticals. 

We will need to consult with lead investors to make sure they feel heard and we collaborate any efforts. 

### Writing guide
[Template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-ja8DGp_CPvfieuxDk8kPZpXbVFoO4rKATX--S7Xuog/edit) we need to complete
[**Draft of Release**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1p6z331oEwvntYwxj9vmaQE6H3ntZJKqjUh7RMd6cEXo/edit)

### Key materials 

- [x] [Pitch deck](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ttdCNrS90CggY3KjSNWCm6Nr3TBHSv-ylUF37B-eAhU/edit#slide=id.geea40cfd73_0_324)
- [x] Metrics- community, product usage, adoption, contributors. Things to show virality and scope.
- [x] High level messaging (Emily working on new one-pager)
- [ ] estimated market size
- [ ] Hiring pitch (include what we are specifically looking for)
- [x] review near term priorities
- [ ] quote from Ethan
- [ ] start thinking about someone from the community who might be able to offer a [quote](https://gitlab.com/meltano/marketing/marketing-general/-/issues/378) 

### Key Details
#### Blurb: 
Meltano (https://meltano.com) is the open source DataOps OS that bridges the gap between DevOps and the modern data stack. It lets data teams manage all their data tools in one place and treat their entire data platform like a coherent internal software product, unlocking best practices such as version control and CI/CD that enable more effective collaboration and rapid iteration to meet the ever-evolving needs of the organization so it can keep its data edge.
#### Why now: 
The modern data stack continues to expand, and the lack of infrastructure tooling to manage the increasing complexity leaves organizations unable to move fast and make the most of their data. Software development best practices such as DevOps provide many answers, but cannot be applied directly to a set of tools held together by ad-hoc integrations (i.e. duct tape).
Differentiation: Meltano was founded inside GitLab, who build the leading open source DevOps platform, and spun out in 2021 by its first engineering manager and data lead. Building an open source developer tool in constant collaboration with a thriving community of contributors is in their DNA, and they see the parallels between data engineering and software development and the opportunity to bridge them more clearly than anyone else.
#### Traction:
- https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano
- 2100+ Slack members
- 378 contributions in 2021
- 2000+ monthly active projects
- 370k+ monthly pipeline runs
- Used by thousands of organizations including Netlify, Zapier, HackerOne, Remote, GitLab, Twilio, VOX Media

#### Team: 
Company was founded by Douwe Maan (CEO), who was GitLab employee #10, became its first engineering manager in 2016, took over the internal Meltano project in 2020, and spun it out in 2021. He is joined by GitLab’s first data, marketing, community, and technical sales people, as well as software and data engineers coming from Amazon, Slalom Consulting, Rackspace, and Netlify.

<!-- Labels to add for triaging -->
~"valuestream::Business Operation" 
~"kind::Non-Product"

_decoded_content.title: DataOps with Meltano Video
_decoded_content.description:
### Activity 
DataOps with Meltano intro video 

### Background
- Goal: quick explainer video of what DataOps is, What Meltnao does/problems it solves for
- Audience: Data Engineers and DevOps practitioners working in Data
- Budget and timeline: 6 weeks, 10k (needs to be evergreen- usable for 12 months). Avoid specific product shots and anything that will not age as the product rapidly evolved. Stay to high-level unchanging things. 
- Style: simple, quick informative
- Duration: 30  seconds to 1 min
- Animation vs live action: prefer animated or graphical over live action
- Script (see below)
- Voice over needed- yes
- where will the video live: website (explore pages, social, youtube static video)

### Inspiration: 
- [Airtable](https://youtu.be/r0lsyTaAuJE)
- [King Arthur video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RBsY88Lir-A) like this illustrative style and kind of comic book feel. Would like to adopt with our primary colors strategically placed.

### Script outline:
* DevOps intro
* We are in Data Era
* DataOps intro
* Where Meltano fits in

## Concepting:
* data and dev meet-cute - they become creative partners
* The missing piece but for DataOps (the epic quest)
* overcoming the monster (monster being the current situation of tooling)
* misunderstood Melty (the mellow dragon) - hero's journey or quest 


<!-- Labels to add for triaging -->
~"valuestream::Business Operation" 
~"kind::Non-Product"

_decoded_content.title: Homepage Animation/ Image (V2)
_decoded_content.description:
### Activity 
carrying over the thread from slack https://meltano.slack.com/archives/C027405T4G1/p1639001478141800

### Background
Pivot from having an image that shows ELT offering and evolve it to rep DataOps OS. please add thought on how to get there. 

Current animation focusing on ELT offering:

![Meltano_V7](/uploads/bdab82b46d9fd3b31536be9ce75183f4/Meltano_V7.mp4)

<details><summary>Suggestions already being addressed</summary>

Taylors suggestions:
>>>
I love the animation, my only concern is with the logos. Having snowplow at the top is very misleading and could cause a lot of questions. we’re also listing grouparoo, great expectations, and lightdash which we don’t support (yet)…

- Move the singer logo to the Red
- Bring the lightdash logo to yellow
- Have the Dagster logo replace where lightdash was
- Drop the grouparoo logo (kangaroo)
- Replace the Grouparoo logo with the Soda SQL logo https://github.com/sodadata/soda-sql
Or, alternatively, move all of the plugins we intend to integrate with to the yellow (lightdash, dagster, great expectations, singer) and have the bottom be Airflow and dbt. with Singer at the top.
>>>

Douwe's suggestions:
>>>
The animation looks cool, but I think the “Your sources”, “Your Meltano project” and “Your destination” labels are confusing in these places, especially with the Meltano logo on the left and the laptop on the right.

I would move the laptop to the bottom left and turn it so that the pipeline takes place behind the screen, as if the person at the laptop sees it run from left to right. And I think the Meltano logo would make most sense on the red “Meltano project” chip
>>>
</details>

_decoded_content.title: Blog/Webpage - Meltano Key Features Comparison
_decoded_content.description:
Airbyte's Meltano [comparison page](https://airbyte.io/etl-tools/meltano-alternative-airbyte) calls out a matrix of features that it values. Most of those are very ELT specific and are disconnected from what features we value as a DataOps platform.

It would be good to have a matrix of our own that can highlight features in a more DataOps focused way. Maybe we have a section of a matrix for ELT and Singer but fill the majority of the matrix with DataOps features that Meltano has and other ELT tools dont. Like versioning, CI, separate environments, code reviews, testability, etc.

This could maybe be a blog post highlighting the features and then maybe an evergreen page on the website.

Considerations:
- we should think about avoiding directly comparing to companies like "Meltano vs Airbyte/Fivetran/etc." because it might encourage people to think of us as just an ELT tool thats directly competing

<!-- Labels to add for triaging -->

_decoded_content.title: Create a landing page for a SaaS-solution
_decoded_content.description:
It's come up a few times where users have questions about whether we're planning on offering a managed Meltano service. It may be useful to have a landing page where we can explain our current focus and point them to the roadmap. It could also be useful to gather some emails or Slack ids to communicate to these folks once we're in a place to offer a SaaS.

@Emily @afolson thoughts on where this could live on the site?

---
- Url: https://meltano.com/saas might also want a similar enterprise page
- Location (nesting): nest under "Product"
- H1: Managed Meltano
- H2: Managed hosting for your data stack / managed hosted DataOps platform
- Key Words: Enterprise, SaaS, Hosted, hosting, managed, Managed Meltano

### Structure
